meanings.definition: To create or invent in a fanciful or imaginative way.
meanings.sent1: She fantasticated a magical world in her story.
meanings.sent2: The author fantasticated a new character for the book.
meanings.sent3: The children fantasticated a secret hideout in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her mind fantasticated a universe of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: His drawings fantasticated creatures beyond imagination.

meanings.definition: To embellish or exaggerate in a fantastical manner.
meanings.sent1: He fantasticated his fishing tale to include a sea monster.
meanings.sent2: The artist fantasticated the colors in the painting to make it pop.
meanings.sent3: The chef fantasticated the dessert with edible glitter.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were so fantasticated that no one believed her.
meanings.sent5: The rumors about the treasure were fantasticated beyond belief.
